message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of generating a full image sequence of a deformable face given only an image and generic facial motions encoded by a set of sparse landmarks. The proposed method builds upon recent breakthroughs in image-to-image translation using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (DCNNs). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also proposes a new architecture that is not driven by labels but by spatial maps, facial landmarks. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper deals with facial expression transfer and facial video creation, which are applications of artificial intelligence. Therefore, the paper may also belong to the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also deals with the generation of realistic face videos, which involves graphics and visualization. Therefore, the paper may also belong to the sub-category cs.GR (Computer Graphics). 

Finally, the paper deals with the creation of videos from a single image, which involves multimedia processing. Therefore, the paper may also belong to the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia).
